experiences.role: Software Development Engineer Intern - Selling Partner Financial Technology
highlights: Cut support tickets by 90% and saved 133 hours/year by building an internal tool for merchant reclassification
Reduced 0.25 FTE of engineering effort by consolidating two legacy systems into a unified web interface
Built an AI agent to detect and fix stuck financial transactions, eliminating 70+ hours/year of manual effort
Redesigned LLM citation handling to support streaming, increasing multi-source citation rate by 161% and contributing to a 62% reduction in response latency
Developed Langfuse metrics in Python to assess LLM attribution, categorization, and quality, using insights to guide prompt tuning and improve citation accuracy
Reduced response time by 53% on repeated sales tip queries by reusing precomputed recommendations
Increased recall of smaller LLMs by 64% through prompt tuning experiments targeting sales use cases
Built and deployed two serverless AI chatbots using AWS CDK for student support and public digital services, enabling 24/7 course Q&A and strategy feedback
Enabled multi-tenant RAG with PGVector, cutting LLM response times by 25% in LangChain pipelines
Reduced infrastructure costs by $3197 USD/year by optimizing deployment architecture across chatbot services
Supervised labs for over 250 undergraduate students, offering guidance during labs and feedback on problem sets

projects.name: BThere
projects.subtitle: BThere is a web app that remembers your friends' names and past conversations, detects how they're feeling, and helps you support them when they're down or deepen your bond when they're doing well

projects.name: Focusaurus
projects.subtitle: Focusaurus is a Chrome extension designed to keep you healthy, productive, and mindful as you navigate your online life

projects.name: SleepCode
projects.subtitle: SleepCode is a platform for practicing JavaScript coding challenges

projects.name: MO:NT
projects.subtitle: MO:NT is a mobile application designed to support the mental health of individuals with muscular dystrophy by enabling them to track their emotions based on location

projects.name: Ecoglo
projects.subtitle: EcoGlo is a Chrome extension for Sephora that assesses beauty product sustainability through ingredient analysis, aiming to empower informed consumer choices

projects.name: Alexandria
projects.subtitle: Alexandria is a PDF document management app powered by AI that converts PDFs into embeddings using OpenAI and Pinecone for efficient querying. It facilitates the retrieval of specific information and explores capabilities such as generating practice questions from analyzed content

projects.name: Wanderers hub
projects.subtitle: Wanderer's Hub is an AI-powered travel app that provides personalized recommendations based on user preferences
projects.period: CrackedDevs X Astra X APEERS Hackathon 2024

projects.name: Brain Stroke Prediction
projects.subtitle: This project focuses on forecasting strokes by using data preprocessing, exploratory analysis, and various machine learning models

kiroves.about: I study math and computer science at the University of British Columbia. I previously worked as a software development engineer intern at Amazon!

profile.name: Garreth Edderick Lee
profile.headline: ML Engineer. I build stuff with AI & data and write about what I learned.

highlights: Improved text extraction for future Fineweb datasets
Tokenizer experiments for mathematical reasoning and detailed report
Internal tools for visualizing & inspecting LLM pretraining data
On‑call ticket routing: 40%→80% accuracy
Improved PII scrubber coverage for LLM gateway
Auto‑update pipeline for in‑house vector DB
Terabyte‑scale pretraining data pipelines
LLM pipeline for document quality evaluation
Language ID integration for HTML parsing (quality ↑)

projects.name: Email Generation Model Fine‑tuning
projects.subtitle: PEFT, Python, Ollama, Transformers
details: Fine‑tuned Mistral 7B to streamline initial email drafts for UBC Biztech's partnerships team
End‑to‑end dataset preparation for training with high‑quality inputs
Deployed locally with Ollama for optimized inference and data control

garreth.about: Previously @ Cohere, Hugging Face, and Wealthsimple.

garrethlee.about: Previously @ Cohere, Hugging Face, and Wealthsimple.

projects.name: Aedifex
projects.subtitle: Breaks down Minecraft build recipes into their constituent materials. Helpful when you're building and crafting and you want to bring the exact amount you need.

projects.name: Cenxur
projects.subtitle: Uses a Naive Bayes classifer to flag inappropriate messages in Discord, to relieve moderator workload. The classifier was implemented fully manually.

projects.name: Goblet
projects.subtitle: A lightweight locally hosted video sharing solution built using Python, JS, Flask, and HTML/CSS. My friends and I wanted to watch movies and TV shows together over the pandemic. This project's key technology is SocketIO, which you can read about how I dealt with the challenges of synchronizing videos across the internet here.

projects.name: Stride
projects.subtitle: My team and I created an Android app that identified people based on their walking patterns using machine learning models trained with data gathered from phone accelerometers.

projects.name: TrafficSim
projects.subtitle: At the Greater Vancouver Regional Science Fair 2018, I built a platform for rapidly testing road formations for better traffic flow using Processing Java.

frankwhoee.about: I find no greater satisfaction than in the process of creation: Creating art, cooking food, writing code. Our purpose on Earth is to see ourselves reflected in the products of our labour, so I hope that at the end of it all, when all is said and done, we will gaze upon the things we have built, the art that we have made, and the people that we have loved—and find ourselves there.
